description: This trap is sent when a new row is created
in the custInfoTable.

event.Summary: Customer $v1 added in customer information table

description: The name of this customer.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::custName

description: This trap is sent when an existing row is
deleted from the custInfoTable.

event.Summary: Customer $v1 deleted from customer information table

description: The name of this customer.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::custName

description: This trap is sent when a new row is created
in the svcBaseInfoTable.

event.Summary: Entry added in service base information table

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: This trap is sent when an existing row is
deleted from the svcBaseInfoTable.

event.Summary: Entry deleted from service base information table

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: The scvStatusChanged notification is generated when
there is a change in the administrative or operating
status of a service.

Summary.eval: ($v4==1 && $v3==1) ? 'Service in up state' : 'Service admin status: $v3; operating status: $v4'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSvcStatusChanged PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcVpnId u 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcOperStatus i 2
$SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSvcStatusChanged PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcVpnId u 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcOperStatus i 1

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: This object specifies the ID used by Service Provider(SP).
It will have different format according to the type of
service.
This filed is mandatory. If all mandatory fields are
set, the row status object is automatically changed from notReady(3)
to notInService(2) state
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcVpnId

description: The desired state of this service.
1. The transition from down(2) state to up(1) state can
be done only if svcRowStatus is either active(1) or
notInSercvice(2).
2. The transition from up(1) to down(2) state has to be
done in order to modify svcRowStatus object.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcAdminStatus

description: The operating state of this service.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcOperStatus

description: This trap is sent when a new row is created
in the sapBaseInfoTable.

event.Summary: Entry added in service access point base information table

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSapCreated PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapPortId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapEncapValue u 9999

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: The ID of the access port where this SAP
is defined.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapPortId

description: The value of the label used to identify this
SAP on the access port specified by sapPortId.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapEncapValue

description: This trap is sent when an existing row is
deleted from the sapBaseInfoTable.

event.Summary: Entry deleted from service access point base information table

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSapDeleted PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapPortId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapEncapValue u 9999

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: The ID of the access port where this SAP
is defined.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapPortId

description: The value of the label used to identify this
SAP on the access port specified by sapPortId.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapEncapValue

description: The sapStatusChanged notification is generated
when there is a change in the administrative or
operating status of an SAP.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1 && $v4==1) ? 'SAP in up state' : 'SAP admin status: $v4; operating status: $v5'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSapStatusChanged PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapPortId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapEncapValue u 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapOperStatus i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSapStatusChanged PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapPortId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapEncapValue u 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapAdminStatus i 2 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapOperStatus i 1

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: The ID of the access port where this SAP
is defined.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapPortId

description: The value of the label used to identify this
SAP on the access port specified by sapPortId.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapEncapValue

description: The desired state of this SAP.
1. The value of this object depends on the value of svcAdminStatus
for the service this sap belongs to. If the sap is created and
its service has svcAdminStatus set to down(2), its own admin status
will be down(2), otherwise sapAdminStatus will be up(1).
2. If sapRowStatus is in notInService state, the sapAdminStatus
transition from down(2) to up(1) state will automaticaly change the
value of the sapRowStatus object to active(1)
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapAdminStatus

description: The operating state of this SAP, showing also the reason for the
current operation state
Values ingressQosMismatch(3),egressQosMismatch(4),svcAdminDown(5)
and portMtuTooSmall(6) are not supported
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sapOperStatus

description: This trap is sent when a new row is created
in the sdpInfoTable.

event.Summary: Entry added in SDP information table

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: SDP identifier.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpId

description: This trap is sent when an existing row is
deleted from the sdpInfoTable.

event.Summary: Entry deleted from SDP information table

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: SDP identifier.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpId

description: The sdpStatusChanged notification is generated
when there is a change in the administrative or
operating status of an SDP.

Summary.eval: ($v4==1 && $v3==1) ? 'SDP in up state' : 'SDP admin status: $v3; operational status: $v4'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSdpStatusChanged PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpId u 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpOperStatus i 2
$SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-SERV-MIB::prvtSdpStatusChanged PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId i 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpId u 9999 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpAdminStatus i 1 PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpOperStatus i 1

description: The service ID.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::svcId

description: SDP identifier.
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpId

description: The desired state of this SDP.
1. The value of this object depends on the value of svcAdminStatus.
It will be rejected to set sdpAdminStatus to up(1), when svcAdminStatus
is set to down(2).
2. If sdpRowStatus is in notInService state, the transition of sdpAdminStatus
from down(2) to up(1) state will also automaticaly change the
value of the sdpRowStatus object to active(1)
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpAdminStatus

description: The operating state of this SDP.
1. Sdp is up and running.
2. Initial state. Entry is inactive.
3. Peers are ready to select transport.
4. There is no suitable transport.
5. SDP is not operational due to local/remote SAP down or remote SDP has no transport.
6. Sdp is up and ready to carry user traffic but it is not used at the moment (backup).
variables.name: PRVT-SERV-MIB::sdpOperStatus
